Posted By: IUHoosier (9/24/2011 7:20:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Another one of those "so close" cards, in my opinion anyways. Sure, it's a double [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon), which is a decent card to begin with. But being a sorcery is a **huge** setback for this card, and flashback for {4}{U} doesn't help its case. Even with the heavy flashback cost, I'd consider it if it were {1}{U} but instant.  
  
It could have some use in some more aggressive decks for removing blockers twice, but control really needs to bounce those creatures during combat.
posts.html:
Another one of those "so close" cards, in my opinion anyways. Sure, it's a double Unsummon, which is a decent card to begin with. But being a sorcery is a huge setback for this card, and flashback for {4}{U} doesn't help its case. Even with the heavy flashback cost, I'd consider it if it were {1}{U} but instant.

It could have some use in some more aggressive decks for removing blockers twice, but control really needs to bounce those creatures during combat.

Posted By: Gabriel422 (9/23/2011 2:34:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What I like about magic most is that cards themselves will not win you game (except few broken cards), it's YOU who need to win the game. You can build perfect machine out of imperfect parts.   
This proved to be really great piece of my [Burning Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Vengeance) deck. When I was fighting my friend's vampire deck, which is really fast and deadly, with [Runic Repetition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runic Repetition) I was able to control the board with this for really long time... and it was awesome :)   
Still, I would love to see it as an instant, or a pernament bouncing. Let's hope for Dark Ascension...
posts.html:

Still, I would love to see it as an instant, or a pernament bouncing. Let's hope for Dark Ascension...

Posted By: Narim (12/13/2011 10:51:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card can't have a rating low enough of the scale for my opinion. It's terrible, six mana to double unsummon, but only on your turn? This turn isn't even close to the caliber of how good unsummon or vapor snag are. I'd even run anything else that is an instant and returns creatures over this card. It's flashback cost is too high to make it a good card. If it's flashback was two or three it be a way better card since it's decent efficiency to return two creatures for even four mana, but the fact that it's still only able to be used on your turn makes it handicapped.  
  
  
TL;DR, It's flashback cost is too high, it's extremely handicapped because it's not an instant, not mana efficient enough unless you're running it with one or two [Catalyst Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Catalyst Stone)s.
posts.html:

TL;DR, It's flashback cost is too high, it's extremely handicapped because it's not an instant, not mana efficient enough unless you're running it with one or two Catalyst Stones.

posts.post_content:
Compare and contrast [dematerialize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dematerialize). Sure, it's not the best unsummon effect ever([capsize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=capsize) gets that honour), but it's still very good. You might think that sorcery kills this card, while actually you only need that instant unsummon to either mess up gang blocking or getting rid of something with haste.  
  
Plus, look at the sweet art.
